member.name: T:Serilog.Context.LogContext
member.summary: Holds ambient properties that can be attached to log events. To configure, use the extension method.
member.remarks: The scope of the context is the current logical thread, using (and so is preserved across async/await calls).

member.name: P:Serilog.Context.LogContext.PermitCrossAppDomainCalls
member.summary: When calling into appdomains without Serilog loaded, e.g. via remoting or during unit testing, it may be necesary to set this value to true so that serialization exceptions are avoided. When possible, using the method in a using block around the call has a lower overhead and should be preferred.

member.name: M:Serilog.Context.LogContext.PushProperty(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Push a property onto the context, returning an that can later be used to remove the property, along with any others that may have been pushed on top of it and not yet popped. The property must be popped from the same thread/logical call context.
member.param: The name of the property.
The value of the property.
member.returns: A handle to later remove the property from the context.
member.param: If true, and the value is a non-primitive, non-array type, then the value will be converted to a structure; otherwise, unknown types will be converted to scalars, which are generally stored as strings.
member.returns: A token that must be disposed, in order, to pop properties back off the stack.

member.name: M:Serilog.Context.LogContext.PushProperties(Serilog.Core.ILogEventEnricher[])
member.summary: Push multiple properties onto the context, returning an that can later be used to remove the properties. The properties must be popped from the same thread/logical call context.
member.param: Log Properties to push onto the log context
member.returns: A token that must be disposed, in order, to pop properties back off the stack.

member.name: M:Serilog.Context.LogContext.Suspend
member.summary: Remove all data from the context so that cross- calls can be made without requiring Serilog assemblies to be present in the remote domain.
member.returns: A token that will restore the suspended log context data, if any.
member.remarks: The should not be manipulated further until the return value from this method has been disposed.

The minimum level for events passed through the sink.

Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.

Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.

member.summary: Write log events in a simple text dump format to the specified file.
member.param: Logger sink configuration.
Path to the dump file.
The minimum level for events passed through the sink.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationFullNetFxExtensions.File(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,System.String,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Write log events to the specified file.
member.param: Logger sink configuration.
Path to the file.
The minimum level for events passed through the sink.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
A message template describing the format used to write to the sink. the default is "{Timestamp} [{Level}] {Message}{NewLine}{Exception}".
The maximum size, in bytes, to which a log file will be allowed to grow. For unrestricted growth, pass null. The default is 1 GB.
member.remarks: The file will be written using the UTF-8 character set.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationFullNetFxExtensions.RollingFile(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,System.String,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Write log events to a series of files. Each file will be named according to the date of the first log entry written to it. Only simple date-based rolling is currently supported.
member.param: Logger sink configuration.

String describing the location of the log files, with {Date} in the place of the file date. E.g. "Logs\myapp-{Date}.log" will result in log files such as "Logs\myapp-2013-10-20.log", "Logs\myapp-2013-10-21.log" and so on.
The minimum level for events passed through the sink.
A message template describing the format used to write to the sink. the default is "{Timestamp} [{Level}] {Message}{NewLine}{Exception}".
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
The maximum size, in bytes, to which any single log file will be allowed to grow. For unrestricted growth, pass null. The default is 1 GB.
The maximum number of log files that will be retained, including the current log file. For unlimited retention, pass null. The default is 31.
member.remarks: The file will be written using the UTF-8 character set.

A message template describing the format used to write to the sink. the default is "{Timestamp} [{Level}] {Message}{NewLine}{Exception}".
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationFullNetFxExtensions.AppSettings(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSettingsConfiguration)
member.summary: Reads the <appSettings> element of App.config or Web.config, searching for for keys that look like: serilog:*, which are used to configure the logger. To add a sink, use a key like serilog:write-to:File.path for each parameter to the sink's configuration method. To add an additional assembly containing sinks, use serilog:using. To set the level use serilog:minimum-level.
member.param: Logger setting configuration
member.returns: An object allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.IOFile.FileSink
member.summary: Write log events to a disk file.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.IOFile.FileSink.#ctor(System.String,Serilog.Formatting.ITextFormatter,System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Construct a .
member.param: Path to the file.
Formatter used to convert log events to text.
The maximum size, in bytes, to which a log file will be allowed to grow. For unrestricted growth, pass null. The default is 1 GB.
Character encoding used to write the text file. The default is UTF-8.
member.remarks: The file will be written using the UTF-8 character set.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.IOFile.FileSink.Emit(Serilog.Events.LogEvent)

member.param: The log event to write.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.IOFile.FileSink.Dispose

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.IOFile.NullSink
member.summary: An instance of this sink may be substituted when an instance of the is unable to be constructed.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.BatchedConnectionStatus
member.summary: Manages reconnection period and transient fault response for . During normal operation an object of this type will simply echo the configured batch transmission period. When availabilty fluctuates, the class tracks the number of failed attempts, each time increasing the interval before reconnection is attempted (up to a set maximum) and at predefined points indicating that either the current batch, or entire waiting queue, should be dropped. This Serves two purposes - first, a loaded receiver may need a temporary reduction in traffic while coming back online. Second, the sender needs to account for both bad batches (the first fault response) and also overproduction (the second, queue-dropping response). In combination these should provide a reasonable delivery effort but ultimately protect the sender from memory exhaustion.
member.remarks: Currently used only by , but may provide the basis for a "smart" exponential backoff timer. There are other factors to consider including the desire to send batches "when full" rather than continuing to buffer, and so-on.

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink
member.summary: Base class for sinks that log events in batches. Batching is triggered asynchronously on a timer.
member.remarks: To avoid unbounded memory growth, events are discarded after attempting to send a batch, regardless of whether the batch succeeded or not. Implementers that want to change this behavior need to either implement from scratch, or embed retry logic in the batch emitting functions.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.#ctor(System.Int32,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Construct a sink posting to the specified database.
member.param: The maximum number of events to include in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Free resources held by the sink.
member.param: If true, called because the object is being disposed; if false, the object is being disposed from the finalizer.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.EmitBatch(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Serilog.Events.LogEvent})
member.summary: Emit a batch of log events, running to completion synchronously.
member.param: The events to emit.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.Emit(Serilog.Events.LogEvent)
member.summary: Emit the provided log event to the sink. If the sink is being disposed or the app domain unloaded, then the event is ignored.
member.param: Log event to emit.
member.remarks: The sink implements the contract that any events whose Emit() method has completed at the time of sink disposal will be flushed (or attempted to, depending on app domain state).

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.CanInclude(Serilog.Events.LogEvent)
member.summary: Determine whether a queued log event should be included in the batch. If an override returns false, the event will be dropped.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.PeriodicBatching.PeriodicBatchingSink.OnEmptyBatch
member.summary: Allows derived sinks to perform periodic work without requiring additional threads or timers (thus avoiding additional flush/shut-down complexity).

member.name: T:Serilog.Sinks.RollingFile.RollingFileSink
member.summary: Write log events to a series of files. Each file will be named according to the date of the first log entry written to it. Only simple date-based rolling is currently supported.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.RollingFile.RollingFileSink.#ctor(System.String,Serilog.Formatting.ITextFormatter,System.Nullable{System.Int64},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Construct a .
member.param: String describing the location of the log files, with {Date} in the place of the file date. E.g. "Logs\myapp-{Date}.log" will result in log files such as "Logs\myapp-2013-10-20.log", "Logs\myapp-2013-10-21.log" and so on.
Formatter used to convert log events to text.
The maximum size, in bytes, to which a log file will be allowed to grow. For unrestricted growth, pass null. The default is 1 GB.
The maximum number of log files that will be retained, including the current log file. For unlimited retention, pass null. The default is 31.
Character encoding used to write the text file. The default is UTF-8.
member.remarks: The file will be written using the UTF-8 character set.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.RollingFile.RollingFileSink.Emit(Serilog.Events.LogEvent)
member.summary: Emit the provided log event to the sink.
member.param: The log event to write.
member.remarks: Events that come in out-of-order (e.g. around the rollovers) may end up written to a later file than their timestamp would indicate.

member.name: M:Serilog.Sinks.RollingFile.RollingFileSink.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
